workflow.name: Track support performance metrics across Zendesk & Freshdesk with Sheets, Slack & Gmail
workflow.description:
## Description
Automatically consolidate Zendesk and Freshdesk ticket data into a unified performance dashboard with KPI calculations, Google Sheets logging, real-time Slack alerts, and weekly Gmail email reports. Provides complete visibility into support operations, SLA compliance, and customer satisfaction across multiple platforms. ðŸ“ŠðŸ’¬ðŸ“§

## What This Template Does
- Runs weekly on schedule to fetch tickets from both Zendesk and Freshdesk. â°
- Merges ticket data into a standardized JSON structure with normalized priorities, statuses, and channels. ðŸ”„
- Logs all tickets and metadata into Google Sheets for audit-ready performance tracking. ðŸ“‘
- Calculates advanced KPIs including resolution rates, SLA breaches, CSAT score estimation, urgent ticket rates, and performance grading. ðŸ“Š
- Evaluates alert conditions (e.g., high SLA breach, low CSAT, backlog risk). ðŸš¨
- Sends formatted Slack alerts with performance grades, key metrics, and recommendations. ðŸ’¬
- Generates corporate-style HTML weekly reports and delivers them via Gmail. ðŸ“§

## Key Benefits
- Unifies Zendesk and Freshdesk data into one consistent reporting flow. ðŸŒ
- Provides actionable KPIs for SLA monitoring, customer satisfaction, and backlog health. â±ï¸
- Ensures leadership visibility with Google Sheets logs and professional email reports. ðŸ§¾
- Alerts the support team instantly on Slack when performance drops. ðŸš¨
- Reduces manual data analysis with automated grading and recommendations. ðŸ¤–

## Features
- Multi-Platform Ticket Integration â€“ Fetches tickets from Zendesk and Freshdesk. ðŸŽ«
- Data Normalization â€“ Cleans descriptions, maps priorities/statuses, and detects escalations. ðŸ§¼
- Google Sheets Logging â€“ Tracks tickets with IDs, URLs, tags, timestamps, and metadata. ðŸ“ˆ
- KPI Calculation Engine â€“ Computes SLA breach rate, resolution rate, CSAT, escalation %, and more. ðŸ§®
- Performance Grading â€“ Grades support performance (Aâ€“D) with detailed descriptions. ðŸ…
- Slack Alerts â€“ Notifies with active alerts, recommendations, and emoji-based health signals. ðŸ“¢
- Weekly Gmail Reports â€“ Delivers branded HTML reports for management and audits. âœ¨

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Zendesk API credentials with ticket read access.
- Freshdesk API credentials with ticket read access.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with spreadsheet write permissions.
- Slack Bot API credentials with posting permissions.
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials with send email permissions.
- Pre-configured Google Sheet for KPI logging.

## Target Audience
- Support managers overseeing multi-platform ticketing systems. ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ’»
- Customer success teams monitoring SLA compliance and CSAT health. ðŸš€
- SMBs running Zendesk + Freshdesk who need unified dashboards. ðŸ¢
- Remote/global support teams needing automated KPI visibility. ðŸŒ
- Executives requiring weekly performance reports and recommendations. ðŸ“ˆ

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect Zendesk, Freshdesk, Google Sheets, Slack, and Gmail credentials in n8n. ðŸ”‘
- Update the Google Sheet ID in the â€œLog KPIs in Google Sheetsâ€ node. ðŸ“Š
- Configure Slack channel ID for alerts (default: zendesk-churn-alerts). ðŸ’¬
- Replace {Enter Your Email} in the Gmail node with your recipient email. ðŸ“§
- Adjust thresholds in the KPI calculation node (default: 4h response, 24h resolution). â±ï¸
- Test with sample tickets to validate Sheets logging, Slack alerts, and Gmail reports. âœ…
- Deploy on schedule (default: weekly at 8 PM) for continuous tracking. ðŸ—“ï¸

workflow.name: Unified Support Team Performance Dashboard (Zendesk & Freshdesk â†’ Google Sheets + Slack + Gmail)

parameters.jsCode:
// N8N Code Node - Generate Corporate Style HTML Email Report // Handle different data structures let data; if ($json.kpis) { data = $json.kpis; } else if ($json[0] && $json[0].kpis) { data = $json[0].kpis; } else if (Array.isArray($json) && $json[0] && $json[0].kpis) { data = $json[0].kpis; } else { data = $json; } // Validate data if (!data || !data.performance_grade) { return { json: { error: "Invalid data structure. Expected KPIs object with performance_grade property.", receivedData: $json } }; } // Function to get grade styling function getGradeStyle(grade) { const styles = { 'A': { color: '#059669', bg: '#ECFDF5', border: '#10B981' }, 'B': { color: '#D97706', bg: '#FFFBEB', border: '#F59E0B' }, 'C': { color: '#DC2626', bg: '#FEF2F2', border: '#EF4444' }, 'D': { color: '#B91C1C', bg: '#FEF2F2', border: '#DC2626' }, 'F': { color: '#991B1B', bg: '#FEF2F2', border: '#B91C1C' } }; return styles[grade] || { color: '#6B7280', bg: '#F9FAFB', border: '#D1D5DB' }; } // Format timestamp function formatTimestamp(timestamp) { return new Date(timestamp).toLocaleDateString('en-US', { year: 'numeric', month: 'long', day: 'numeric', hour: '2-digit', minute: '2-digit' }); } const gradeStyle = getGradeStyle(data.performance_grade); const alertStatus = data.any_alert ? 'ALERT' : 'HEALTHY'; const alertColor = data.any_alert ? '#DC2626' : '#059669'; // Generate corporate-style HTML email const htmlReport = ` Support Dashboard Report
${data.any_alert ? ` ` : ''} ${data.recommendations && data.recommendations.length > 0 ? ` ` : ''}

Support Dashboard Report

Daily Performance Analysis
SYSTEM STATUS: ${alertStatus}
${data.performance_grade}
${data.grade_percentage}% - ${data.grade_description}
${data.total_tickets}
Total Tickets
${data.resolved_tickets}
Resolved
${data.open_tickets}
Open
${data.csat_score}
CSAT Score

Performance Metrics

Average Response Time ${data.avg_response_time_hours}h
Average Resolution Time ${data.avg_resolution_time_hours}h
Resolution Rate ${data.resolution_rate}%
SLA Breach Rate ${data.sla_breach_rate}%

âš ï¸ Active Alerts (${data.alert_count})

${data.alerts.high_sla_breach ? ` ` : ''} ${data.alerts.high_attention_rate ? ` ` : ''} ${data.alerts.long_avg_age ? ` ` : ''}
ðŸ”´ High SLA Breach Rate: ${data.sla_breach_rate}%
ðŸŸ  High Attention Required Rate: ${data.attention_required_rate}%
â° Long Average Ticket Age: ${data.avg_ticket_age_hours}h

ðŸ’¡ Recommendations

${data.recommendations.map((rec, index) => ` `).join('')}
â€¢ ${rec}

Distribution Analysis

${Object.entries(data.priority_distribution).map(([priority, count]) => ` `).join('')}
Priority Distribution
${priority} ${count}
${Object.entries(data.channel_distribution).map(([channel, count]) => ` `).join('')}
Channel Distribution
${channel} ${count}

Report Generated: ${formatTimestamp(data.timestamp)}
Support Dashboard Analytics System

`; // Return the corporate-style HTML report return { json: { html: htmlReport, subject: `Support Dashboard Report - Grade ${data.performance_grade} | ${alertStatus}`, plainText: `Support Ticket Dashboard Report Performance Grade: ${data.performance_grade} (${data.grade_percentage}%) - ${data.grade_description} Status: ${alertStatus} Key Metrics: - Total Tickets: ${data.total_tickets} - Open: ${data.open_tickets} | Resolved: ${data.resolved_tickets} - Resolution Rate: ${data.resolution_rate}% - CSAT Score: ${data.csat_score}/5.0 Performance: - Avg Response Time: ${data.avg_response_time_hours}h - Avg Resolution Time: ${data.avg_resolution_time_hours}h - SLA Breach Rate: ${data.sla_breach_rate}% ${data.any_alert ? `Active Alerts: ${data.alert_count}` : 'No active alerts'} Report generated: ${formatTimestamp(data.timestamp)}` } };

parameters.content:
## â° Weekly Cron Trigger

This node runs the workflow automatically on a **weekly schedule**.  
Configured to execute every week at the specified hour (20:00).

**Purpose:**
- Ensures weekly performance reporting.
- Automates ticket fetching and KPI calculations.

## ðŸŽŸï¸ Fetch Tickets from Zendesk

Fetches all ticket data from your **Zendesk account**.

**Details:**
- Uses Zendesk API credentials.
- Retrieves tickets with statuses (open, pending, solved, closed).
- Provides raw ticket data for further formatting.

## ðŸš¨ Evaluate Alerts

Checks if KPI thresholds have been exceeded and if alerts need to be triggered.

**Alert Triggers:**
- SLA breach > 20%
- Low resolution rate
- High backlog
- Low CSAT score
- High urgent or attention rate
- Long average ticket age

**Output:**
- Boolean flag `any_alert`
- Alert count

## ðŸ“‘ Log Alerts in Google Sheets

Stores ticket and performance data into a **Google Sheet** for auditing.

**Purpose:**
- Provides a compliance audit trail.
- Enables historical trend analysis.
- Logs KPIs and alerts  for future reporting.

## ðŸ“Š Calculate Support KPIs

Processes formatted ticket data to compute **key performance metrics**.

**Metrics Calculated:**
- SLA breach rate
- Resolution rate
- Avg response & resolution times
- CSAT score (simulated or from Zendesk API)
- Ticket distributions (priority, channel)
- Attention required tickets

**Also:**
- Applies thresholds for alerts
- Generates performance grade (Aâ€“D)
- Builds recommendations list

## ðŸ§¹ Format Ticket Data (Zendesk & FreshDesk)

Cleans and standardizes raw ticket data from both platforms.
Steps:

Auto-detects platform source (Zendesk vs FreshDesk)
Normalizes priority, status, and channel fields across platforms
Adds calculated fields: ticket age, needs_attention flag
Creates unified JSON output structure

## ðŸ’¬ Generate Slack Alert Message

Formats KPI and alert details into a **Slack-ready message**.

**Message Includes:**
- Performance grade & percentage
- Key metrics (tickets, SLA, CSAT)
- Breakdown by priority & channel
- Active alerts with emojis
- Recommendations for improvement
- Timestamp for traceability

## ðŸ“§ Generate Weekly HTML Report

Builds a **corporate-style HTML email report**.

**Report Sections:**
- System status (Healthy / Alert)
- Performance grade (Aâ€“D)
- Key ticket metrics
- KPI values with thresholds
- Active alerts
- Recommendations
- Distribution analysis (priority & channel)

**Format:** HTML + plain text fallback

## ðŸ“¢ Send Alert to Slack

Delivers the formatted alert message into a configured **Slack channel**.

**Purpose:**
- Immediate visibility for critical issues.
- Alerts team to SLA breaches, backlog spikes, or low CSAT.

## âœ‰ï¸ Email Weekly Report

Sends the **weekly HTML report** via Gmail.

**Recipients:** Configured in this node.  
**Purpose:**
- Provides managers with weekly performance summaries.
- Ensures leadership visibility into support KPIs.

## ðŸŽ« Fetch Tickets from FreshDesk
Fetches all ticket data from your FreshDesk account.
Details:

Uses FreshDesk API credentials (API Key authentication).
Retrieves tickets with statuses (Open, Pending, Resolved, Closed).
Supports filtering by status, priority, and date ranges.
Provides raw ticket data for further formatting.

## ðŸ”— Merge Ticket Data
Combines formatted ticket data from multiple sources into a single stream.
Steps:

Merges Zendesk and FreshDesk ticket arrays
Maintains unified data structure from formatter
Passes combined dataset to KPI calculator
Handles different input timing and batch sizes

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
